title: Canadian protesters block busiest international crossing in North America
description: Canadian protesters have impeded access to the busiest international crossing in North America again Tuesday, escalating tensions as frustration over demonstrations against Covid-19 rules continues to roil the nation.

title: Document shredding, Trump style
description: Donald Trump arguably built his winning bid for the presidency in 2016 around two basic themes: America First nativism and the allegation that Hillary Clinton broke the law with her emails.

title: Kamala Harris' husband ushered out of high school room after bomb threat
description: Second gentleman Doug Emhoff was ushered out of a room at a Washington, DC, high school by the Secret Service due to a bomg threat to the building, school officials told reporters at the event.

title: China misses trade targets it promised to Trump
description: China fell more than $213 billion short of its commitment to increase purchases of US goods and services that it made to then-President Donald Trump in 2020, according to a report released Tuesday.

title: Putin's use of crude language reveals a lot about his worldview
description: • Russia pours cold water on Ukraine crisis de-escalation

title: Brit Awards 2022: See the full list of winners
description: Adele and Ed Sheeran are among the top contenders for the 2022 Brit Awards, with four nominations each.

title: Leslie Jones can keep up unfiltered Olympics commentary, NBC says
description: Leslie Jones can keep posting unfiltered videos of herself commenting on the Olympics, according to NBC.

title: Add up to 13 years to your life by changing your diet, study says. Here's how
description: Changing what you eat could add up to 13 years to your life, according to a newly published study, especially if you start when you are young.a

title: Elon Musk launched his own Tesla roadster to space four years ago. Where is it now?
description: Four years ago this week, the most powerful operational rocket in the world, SpaceX's Falcon Heavy, made its inaugural launch from Florida and tore into outer space carrying nothing other than Elon Musk's personal Tesla roadster.

title: Hyundai and Kia tell owners of nearly 500,000 vehicles to park outside due to fire risk
description: Hyundai and Kia are telling owners of almost 500,000 cars and SUVs in the United States to park outside and away from buildings due to a possible defect that can cause the vehicles to spontaneously catch fire even when not running.

title: This is where most of the US supply of fentanyl comes from
description: In a CNN exclusive interview, DEA administrator Anne Milgram explains how fentanyl is coming into the US, why more Americans are becoming addicted to the drug, and what role social media plays in drug trafficking.

title: Mesmerizing photos from the Sony World Photography Awards 2022
description: A black and white picture of a giant-tusked elephant, a self portrait of a woman blowing a puff of smoke and a majestic white horse bowing to the camera are among the winners in the National Awards program of the Sony World Photography Awards 2022.

title: Analysis: Why the Trump-National Archives story is a huge deal
description: • McConnell slams RNC over censure resolution

title: Soccer star filmed kicking and slapping cat
description: Footage of West Ham United defender Kurt Zouma kicking and slapping ​a cat has emerged online, leading the French center-back to issue an apology and the Premier League club to condemn the video content​, according to Reuters.

title: Peloton is replacing its CEO and cutting 2,800 jobs
description: Peloton is reportedly replacing embattled CEO John Foley and cutting about 20% of its corporate workforce to help reinvigorate the flailing fitness company.

title: Retired nun who embezzled from school to pay for her gambling habit, sentenced to prison
description: The now-retired nun and former Catholic elementary school principal who admitted to stealing more than $835,000 in school funds for gambling trips and personal expenses was sentenced Monday to 12 months and a day in federal prison, according to federal prosecutors.

title: Javier Bardem and Penélope Cruz join history with their Oscar nominations
description: Javier Bardem and Penélope Cruz are in good company.

title: Billie Eilish, Ariana DeBose, Olivia Colman and more react to their Oscar nominations
description: The 2022 Oscar nominations were announced on Tuesday.

title: Teen sensation Eileen Gu wins gold and crashes the Chinese internet
Putin's use of crude language reveals a lot about his worldview
Pope asks for forgiveness but denies wrongdoing over child sex abuse cases
description: Pope Benedict XVI has pushed back against accusations that he knew in 1980 that a priest under his control was an abuser, while denying he had intentionally concealed his presence at a meeting about the priest that year.

title: This English pub is closing after 1,200 years
description: Ye Olde Fighting Cocks Pub has been in business since 793 A.D. but because of pandemic hardships, the pub is closing its doors. The owner of the pub Christo Tofalli joins New Day to discuss.

title: Sprawling sponge gardens found deep beneath the Arctic sea ice
description: Deep beneath the ice covering the central Arctic Ocean, an unlikely community thrives off of ancient relics.

title: The Supreme Court may completely hollow out the Voting Rights Act by 2024
description: The Supreme Court's action late Monday in an Alabama redistricting case foreshadows a new threat to the Voting Rights Act of 1965 and electoral opportunities for Blacks and other racial minorities nationwide.

title: See the full list of 2022 Oscar nominations
description: The nominations for the 94th Academy Awards were announced Tuesday and included films in a wide range of genres.

title: The Michelin star chef blazing a trail for sustainable gastronomy
description: In the quiet, snow-covered Slovenian village of Šentjošt nad Horjulom, where fields stretch for miles, it would be easy to miss the restaurant tucked away on the top of the hill. Grič -- meaning literally "hill" in Slovenian -- has been in the Košir family for generations and the restaurant embodies the concept of eating locally.

title: Pete Davidson makes it official with Kim Kardashian -- sort of
description: Pete Davidson referred to his "girlfriend" in the same interview in which we learned he has a Kim Kardashian candle and it was the official confirmation the world needed, apparently.

title: Teenage sensation Eileen Gu wins gold -- and crashes the Chinese internet
description:
• Reporters press Eileen Gu over her citizenship. See her response
• Live updates: Day 5 of the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics

title: Gold medalist dodges questions over citizenship confusion
description: Despite Eileen Gu's choice to compete for China, it's unclear whether she renounced her American citizenship -- usually a requirement for Chinese naturalization, since the country does not allow dual citizenship. Gu has never publicly commented on the status of her American citizenship, though an article on the official Olympic site referred to her "dual nationality" in January. At a news conference after her win on Tuesday, reporters asked Gu several times if she was still a US citizen.

title: How London almost got its own Eiffel Tower
description: Somewhere beneath the pitch of England's national stadium in Wembley, London, lie the foundations of what could have been the city's tallest building. Inspired by the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the Great Tower of London was poised to surpass it in height and reach almost 1,200 feet.

title: Proudly Ndebele: South Africa's Zana Masombuka showcases her heritage through modern expressions of art
description: Raised in a small, rural town called Siyabuswa, in the KwaNdebele region of north-eastern South Africa, Zana Masombuka is on a mission to create art that bridges old and new Africa. Inspired by her Ndebele roots, she explores concepts including African identity and cultural complexity, as well as how indigenous cultures and modernity both collide and coexist.

title: Neil Young says Spotify staffers should 'get out of the place before it eats up your soul'
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Asia's got a new richest person
description: India's Gautam Adani has overtaken his fellow countryman Mukesh Ambani to become the wealthiest person in Asia, according to Bloomberg's list of the world's richest people.

title: Minor attacked in tweet by Republican governor's campaign speaks with CNN
description: CNN's John Berman speaks to high school student Ethan Lynne, who shares his reaction to a tweet about him sent from Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin's campaign.

title: Hilarious moment as dog calms a ranting soccer coach
description: Dog calms coach ranting at the TV. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: 'Wave off! Wave off!' Stealth fighter's landing goes all wrong
description: A video posted on social media over the weekend shows the stealth fighter that crashed on a US Navy aircraft carrier last month bursting into flames as it strikes the flight deck of the massive warship.

title: Chimpanzees apply 'medicine' to each others' wounds in a possible show of empathy
description: For the first time, chimpanzees were spotted capturing insects and applying them to their own wounds, as well as the wounds of others, as a form of medication.

title: Day 4 of the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics
Top Biden science adviser apologizes for 'demeaning' colleagues
description: A top science adviser to President Joe Biden, Eric Lander, apologized to staff on Friday for speaking to colleagues in a "disrespectful or demeaning way," after an internal investigation found evidence of workplace conduct policy violations.

title: High-speed drones are revolutionizing how we watch winter sports
description: There's an age-old tension in the world of snowboarding between competition and style. Between sport and entertainment. Between manufactured snowpark slopes and off-piste backcountry runs.

title: Once stained by blood, Misery Beach is now Australia's top stretch of sand
description: It was once flooded with blood, linked to convicts, synonymous with slaughter and haunted by pirates.

title: Covid protests in Canada enter second week; reported hate-related cases probed
description: Canadian authorities continue to face protests over Covid-19 regulations that are now stretching into a second week of blocked roads and boisterous demonstrations.

title: Woman falls to her death after drawbridge opens as she attempted to cross
description: Authorities in West Palm Beach, Florida, are investigating the death of a bicyclist who fell to her death from a drawbridge as it opened.

title: Preparing for Category 6 hurricanes, a new facility will test winds of 200 mph and storm surge
description: I lived and worked in Miami for four years before coming to Atlanta to join CNN. I've visited the Wall of Wind on the Florida International University (FIU) campus many times.
